title: 48 October Prime Day Deals Under $25 You Can Still Buy
description: Did you miss Prime Day or still want to save some cash? These under-$25 deals are still live on Amazon.
author: Adam Oram
excerpt: Did you miss Prime Day or still want to save some cash? These under-$25 deals are still live on Amazon.
text: $25 at Amazon Tapo TP-Link 2K indoor/outdoor security camera: $25 Save $15 $15 at Amazon Franklin pickleball paddle & ball set: $15 Save $15 While Amazon's October Prime Day sale is officially over, we've found a lot of deals from the event that you can still shop. When does Amazon Prime Day start? Amazon's October Prime Day-style event, Prime Big Deal Days, has come and gone. It began on Oct. 8 and ended on Oct. 9. Some markdowns in the annual sale are still available, though, and may stay for a few more days.Do Prime deals change throughout the day?Unfortunately, yes. All the deals we listed here, and the rest of the deals on Amazon, are subject to change at any given time before, after and even during the sale event. Here at CNET, we're constantly going through our pages to make sure that they are updated with the latest prices. Since prices can change at any time, if you see something you like, we recommend buying it as soon as possible before the price changes, the deal expires or the item becomes unavailable.  Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice 04:03 How we choose the best Prime Day dealsMany of us at CNET have covered shopping events for over five years, including Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day, and countless other sales. In that time, we've learned how to spot the best deals among a sea of thousands of superficial offers and scams. We only surface the best offers from trusted retailers. We look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing the best deals to show you. Real discounts mean genuine savings. We check pricing history for products listed as on sale so we know when it's a case of an inflated list price rather than an actual discount. Quality reviews and testing are super important for any product. A discount isn't worthwhile if it results in a subpar product experience, no matter how much you saved. The remaining sale time is important too. Some deals are only around for a short time or may be limited in supply. If that's the case, we'll let you know upfront so you don't come back to the deal later only to be disappointed.How do Prime Day deals compare with Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals?Amazon's Prime Day event and Black Friday/Cyber Monday have many similarities. Anecdotally, Black Friday tends to have better deals on large ticket items such as TVs, home appliances and laptops, whereas Prime Big Deal Days will tend to focus on more everyday essentials and items under $25. If you are looking for a good bargain on stuff you are likely to need all year round, buy them during Prime Big Deal Days. If you are looking for that "once-a-year" bargain, Black Friday is probably your best bet. If you want to beat the holiday rush, there will be plenty of items on sale that make great gifts for loved ones.*All information about the Prime Visa card has been collected independently by CNET and has not been reviewed by the issuer.
html:
$25 at Amazon

Tapo TP-Link 2K indoor/outdoor security camera: $25

Save $15

$15 at Amazon

Franklin pickleball paddle & ball set: $15

Save $15

While Amazon's October Prime Day sale is officially over, we've found a lot of deals from the event that you can still shop. Whether you missed the memo or still need to pick up a couple of things, now is your last chance to score these under-$25 deals on tech, games, home goods and more. Just hurry before they're gone for good.

Hey, did you know? CNET Deals texts are free, easy and save you money.

We'll be updating this list continuously as the deals start running out, so you can keep saving without having to do all the work. We've also gone through all the top deals on Amazon to find the best ones for folks with different budgets, with lists for deals under $10, under $50 and under $100. Want to save some more money on Amazon? You can earn a $150 Amazon gift card instantly with approval of a Prime Visa card*.

Best post-Prime Day tech deals under $25 

This camera is IP66 weatherproof rated with clear 2K resolution and color night vision. It also offers free person, pet and vehicle detection. 

If you want the ease of flipping through streaming options, you'll love the Amazon Fire TV stick. This kit allows you to control your streaming with this remote and watch over 300,000 movies from Amazon-supported apps. It's currently discounted by 50%, which brings the price down to $20.

More post-Prime Day tech deals under $25

  • Anker Soundcore Life 2i wireless neckband: $21 (save $4). This neckband is perfect for people who want wireless earbuds butneed something attached to them to keep better track of them.
  • Iniu wireless charging station: $13 (save $14). Wirelessly charge your devices with this charging stand.
  • Razer wired white gaming mouse: $25 (save $25). An excellent, affordable gaming mouse.
  • Oontz Angle Solo Bluetooth speaker: $20 (save $6). A reasonably priced Bluetooth speaker.
  • Lisen Tesla phone mount: $11 (save $14 with on-page coupon). Get an iPhone phone mount to match your Tesla's style.
  • Ugreen Magnetic phone stand: $13 (save $5, clip on-page coupon). Make sure your iPhone is secure with this MagSafe phone stand.
  • Lisen 240-watt USB-C to USB-C cable: $14 (save $4). Juice up high-power devices with this 240-watt charging cable.
  • Apple AirTag: $25 (save $4). Keep track of your wallet, luggage and more.
  • Skullcandy Jib True 2 in-ear wireless earbuds: $20 (save $20). Listen to tunes while you're working out or working from home with these inexpensive wireless earbuds.
  • Tozo A1 mini wireless earbuds: $19 (save $11, clip on-page coupon). A budget pair of Bluetooth lightweight earbuds that are IPX5 waterproof.
  • Roku Express streaming stick: $18 (save $12). Turn your TV into a smart TV and access HD streaming.
  • Pebblebee Clip Google Find My tracker: $24 (save $6). A long-lasting Bluetooth clip that ensures you never lose your important items.
  • JETech screen protector: $6 (save $2). A Tempered glass film to protect your iPhone from scratches and cracks.
  • Trond clamp power strip: $17 (save $8 with on-page coupon). If you own bulky power adapters, this power strip with five AC outlets that are spaced quite apart can be a great investment. It can be mounted anywhere on your desk for ease of use.
  • Ugreen MagSafe phone holder for bed: $20 (save $10). If you need your phone to be hands-free when in bed, this is a good way to get it done.

Best post-Prime Day smart home deals under $25 

Outdoor smart lighting can cost significantly more than its nonsmart counterparts. A more cost-effective way to make your outdoor lights smart is by adding a smart plug to the system. The plug can be turned on and off via Alexa or Google and can even be used as a dimmer to set the right mood in your backyard. Be sure to clip the on-page coupon for the full discount.

More post-Prime Day smart home deals under $25

  • Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt smart security camera: $22 (save $8). Get some peace of mind with this indoor cam and keep an eye on your pets, kids and more. 
  • Addtam surge protector: $9 (save $7). Plug your devices into hard-to-reach outlets with this rotating surge protector.
  • Dreamegg white noise sound machine: $16 (save $9 with on-page coupon). This travel-size white noise machine offers 16 different sounds to soothe you to sleep. 
  • Amazon Basics smart A19 LED light bulb: $7 (save $6 and get an additional $5 off when you buy 3 or more). These basic smart light bulbs can light up your space on the cheap.
  • TP-Link Tapo Matter Smart Plug Mini: $18 (save $32, clip on-page coupon). Control your smart home devices with these Matter-enabled plugs from TP-Link.
  • Kasa Smart 2K QHD indoor security camera: $23 (save $17). Keep your home safe with this high-resolution indoor security camera.

Best post-Prime Day kitchen and home deals under $25 

This rice cooker has one-touch operation and simultaneous steaming capabilities in a compact six-cup capacity.

Get in on the pickleball craze with this starter set of two pickleball rackets and two pickleballs. These durable paddles are great for beginners to try things out without committing a lot of money. Don't let the beginner part fool you. These paddles are approved for competitive and tournament play if you do find yourself enjoying it.

Why have a stylus, ruler, level, screwdriver, pen and bottle opener when you can get it all in one with this two-piece multitool pen set? 

Are you looking for something quick to grab for two of your kids to do at the park or the beach this summer? These nostalgic outdoor paddles with Velcro on them are a great blast from the past -- '90s-era parents can bond with their kids in merriment. This kit contains two balls and paddles for your kids to play catch in the yard or even in the pool.

More post-Prime Day kitchen and home deals under $25

  • Neutrogena hydro-boost facial cleansing towelettes, 2-pack: $13 (save $4). This twin pack of facial cleansing towelettes is perfect for a quick nighttime or travel skin care routine.
  • Hoojo refrigerator organizer bins: $20 (save $9 with on-page coupon). This eight-piece set can organize your fridge, freezer or pantry.
  • Handy magnetic wristband: $18 (save $1). Keep all screws handy with this ballistic nylon magnetic wristband.
  • Sharpie flip chart markers (8-pack): $9 (save $7). Write on those flip chart pages without fear of the mark going through to the next page. 
  • Sensarte nonstick frying pan: $18 (save $12). Cook up a storm with great savings on this excellent frying pan.
  • Bedsure satin pillowcases (standard size, 2-pack): $8 (save $5). A luxurious set of pillowcases for cheap.
  • Shark blanket hoodie adult onesie: $20 (save $8). Make like a shark and do your thing. 
  • Lilyvane 8-foot fruit picker: $20 (save $2). Get that fruit off the tree without getting up a ladder.
  • X Home rotary cheese grater: $20 (save $7). TikTok brought these back to popularity.
  • Sequence board game: $13 (save $12). The classic, fast-paced game you can win (or lose) in minutes. 
  • Minions Despicable Me 4 Ultimate Fart Blaster: $25 (save $5). Because we all know what really entertains kids.
  • Gigatent pop-up changing room tent: $25 (save $15). This pop-up changing room tent will add a touch of convenience to any camping trip.
  • Fit Simplify exercise bands (5-pack) with carry bag: $10 (save $11). Sturdy exercise bands that take up no space in a gym bag or luggage. 
  • Beakey 10-piece makeup sponge set: $6 (save $7 with on-page coupon). The perfect addition to your makeup kit. 
  • Joseph Joseph Flex Lite steel toilet brush: $17 (save $5). A sleek, inconspicuous toilet brush.
  • Owala FreeSip insulated stainless steel water bottle: $22 (save $6). Stay hydrated on the go with this convenient, portable water bottle.
  • KitchenAid soft silicone oven mitts: $20 (save $15). Keep your hands safe in the kitchen with this two-pack of oven mitts. These are durable, heat-, water- and slip-resistant.
  • Renpho smart scale: $22 (save $13 with on-page coupon). A digital bathroom scale that connects with your smartphone.
  • Elago MagSafe wallet/key holder: $17 (save $3 with on-page coupon). Card pocket that can hold two cards and a key for easy access.
  • WoodWick large hourglass candle (coastal sunset): $20 (save $11). A classy and long-lasting candle to freshen up your home.

When does Amazon Prime Day start?

Amazon's October Prime Day-style event, Prime Big Deal Days, has come and gone. It began on Oct. 8 and ended on Oct. 9. Some markdowns in the annual sale are still available, though, and may stay for a few more days.

Do Prime deals change throughout the day?

Unfortunately, yes. All the deals we listed here, and the rest of the deals on Amazon, are subject to change at any given time before, after and even during the sale event. Here at CNET, we're constantly going through our pages to make sure that they are updated with the latest prices. Since prices can change at any time, if you see something you like, we recommend buying it as soon as possible before the price changes, the deal expires or the item becomes unavailable. 

Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice

04:03

How we choose the best Prime Day deals

Many of us at CNET have covered shopping events for over five years, including Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day, and countless other sales. In that time, we've learned how to spot the best deals among a sea of thousands of superficial offers and scams. We only surface the best offers from trusted retailers. We look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing the best deals to show you. 

  • Real discounts mean genuine savings. We check pricing history for products listed as on sale so we know when it's a case of an inflated list price rather than an actual discount. 
  • Quality reviews and testing are super important for any product. A discount isn't worthwhile if it results in a subpar product experience, no matter how much you saved. 
  • The remaining sale time is important too. Some deals are only around for a short time or may be limited in supply. If that's the case, we'll let you know upfront so you don't come back to the deal later only to be disappointed.

How do Prime Day deals compare with Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals?

Amazon's Prime Day event and Black Friday/Cyber Monday have many similarities. Anecdotally, Black Friday tends to have better deals on large ticket items such as TVs, home appliances and laptops, whereas Prime Big Deal Days will tend to focus on more everyday essentials and items under $25.

If you are looking for a good bargain on stuff you are likely to need all year round, buy them during Prime Big Deal Days. If you are looking for that "once-a-year" bargain, Black Friday is probably your best bet. If you want to beat the holiday rush, there will be plenty of items on sale that make great gifts for loved ones.

*All information about the Prime Visa card has been collected independently by CNET and has not been reviewed by the issuer.
